intro: Epidendrum schenckianum, commonly known as the Schenck's Epidendrum, is a member of the Orchidaceae family native to Central and South America. It is an epiphytic plant, typically growing on trees or rocks in humid tropical environments. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, often arranged in racemes. Its pseudobulbs are cylindrical and help store water, adapting it to its often-dry habitats. The leaves are usually elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in photosynthesis.
